E. L. Doctorow           The NYU Creative Writing Program, among the most distinguished programs in the country, is a leading national center for the study of writing and literature. The undergraduate and graduate programs provide students with an opportunity to develop their craft while working closely with some of the finest poets and novelists writing today. The Creative Writing Program now occupies a lovely townhouse on West 10th Street in the same Greenwich Village neighborhood where so many writers have lived and worked. The Lillian Vernon Creative Writers House allows writers--established and emerging--to share their work in an inspiring setting. We invite you to join a supportive and serious community of writers engaged in an exceptional program of study. Noncredit Offerings                                                                                          The NYU School of Professional Studies Website    Faculty    Degrees    Professional Certificates    Upcoming Events        Search Courses     Credit Course     Non-Credit Course          Site    Noncredit Courses    Faculty                                                                       Humanities, Arts, and Writing                                                                                           About             Director's Message Faculty News                   Admissions                 Academics             M.S. in Professional Writing Noncredit Offerings                   Career                 Events             Art Law Day Art Crime Symposium                   Highlights             Movies 101 Modern British Drama in London Oxford University Study Program                                                     Noncredit Offerings                                            Academics ›                M.S. in Professional Writing            Noncredit Offerings                 Certificate in Appraisal Studies in Fine and Decorative Arts          Certificate in Art Business          Certificate in Art Collections Management and Display          Certificate in Art Marketing and Communications          Certificate in Arts Administration          Certificate in Book Publishing: Print and Digital          Certificate in Communication Skills          Certificate in Creative Writing          Certificate in Editing          Certificate in Journalism: Print and Digital Media          Certificate in Magazine and Website Publishing          Certificate in Screenwriting          Summer Intensive in Creative Writing                                  Ready to Proceed?           Register Now        Request Information        Events                                                                  Whether your goal is to move ahead in your career, change your professional direction, or deepen your appreciation of the humanities, arts, and writing, you’ll find a rich array of noncredit courses and certificates from which to choose. Explore subjects that stir your imagination with faculty members who are eager to share their expertise and their passion. Enjoy the intellectual stimulation of a vibrant learning community.           Ready to Proceed?        Register for Courses Now                 Noncredit Courses        Whether analyzing an artistic masterpiece, taking in a theatrical performance, or immersing yourself in a creative writing project, studying the world's greatest forms of human expression provides an ideal way to broaden your horizons. Through thought-provoking discussion and intellectual exploration, the NYU School of Professional Studies continuing education courses in the humanities and the performing arts help you to sharpen your critical thinking skills, engage in cultural discovery, and communicate with diverse audiences.   Our courses in literature, film, theater, performing arts, history, archaeology, philosophy, and religion can spark your curiosity and challenge you to view the world from a fresh perspective. Read and discuss great books. Discover the masters of American cinema or become engrossed in the work of modern European philosophers. Explore New York City's theater scene as an audience member or take to the stage in one of our many acting and performance courses.            A Selection of Courses From This Department                                              Appraisal of Historical Textiles and Clothing                                                            Great Choral Compositions in Classical Music                                                            Independent Study in Photography                                                            Literature and Film Go Back to High School                                                            Manhattan's Residential Secrets                                                            Writing Film Dialogue                                                                               View all Humanities, Arts, and Writing Noncredit Courses           Certificates        If you’re seeking an effective way to move your career forward, earning a noncredit certificate through the NYU School of Professional Studies allows you to acquire proficiency in a specific professional arena. Designed to accommodate the schedules of busy professionals, certificate programs offer in-depth knowledge and unique insights into subject matter, allowing you to gain significant expertise and industry-specific skills. This powerful credential can help you to achieve your career goals and greatly enhance your résumé. Journalism: Print and Digital Media          Certificate in Magazine and Website Publishing          Certificate in Screenwriting          Summer Intensive in Creative Writing                                                                                                         Creative Writing                            Poetry, Fiction, and Creative Nonfiction        Program Information   Dates : June 14-26, 2015   Application Deadline : May 10, 2015   Tuition : $2,860   Course No. : WRIT1-CE9082 (noncredit) or CWRG1-DC5292 (undergraduate credit)     Program Contact :   Phone : (212) 998-7091 or  (212) 998-7174   E-mail : rd2@nyu.edu                 Apply Now        Become a member of a selective writers' community this summer. This intensive two-week program is designed for poets, fiction writers, and nonfiction writers who wish to develop their process and to refine their craft in one of these areas.   During the two-week period, you will spend six mornings in improvisation workshops taught by the NYU School of Professional Studies Paul McGhee Division faculty members. These workshops will help you to find new ways of generating and revising text. You will participate in seven craft workshops in either poetry or prose that are taught by distinguished visiting writers. Valzhyna Mort is the invited poet; Etgar Keret , the invited fiction writer; and Saïd Sayrafiezadeh , the invited nonfiction writer. During two of the seven sessions, you will work with a writer in a genre other than your own. You also will have private conferences with the craft teacher in your area of concentration during the two-week workshop. In the evenings, you will attend readings, lectures, and social events.             Who Should Register?   Students must apply for admission to the program. A maximum of 12 poets, 12 fiction writers, and 12 nonfiction writers will be chosen to participate. Participants should have some prior coursework in poetry or prose. Students may apply on a credit or noncredit basis. Those taking the course for credit will be asked to submit additional written materials later in the summer.   Tuition   The total noncredit tuition is $2,860. The cost excludes transportation, housing, and meals. Students taking the course for credit pay the regular fee for a four-credit course in the NYU School of Professional Studies Paul McGhee Division .
